page.title: 08The River Wandle.
page.content: The River Wandle is a tributary of the Thames and it flows through the Boroughs of Merton and Sutton for part of its course.Two tributaries flow from Carshalton Ponds and Waddon Ponds then join together at Beddington.It then flows through Merton and joins the Thames at Wandsworth. The original Domesday Book mentions the existance of mills in Merton and Morden;these would have been powered by Wandle water.Modern industry on the Willow Lane Estate lies on the east bank of the River. On the west bank is a National Trust area,Watermeads, which is fenced off and can only be entered Key holders. The river can also be reached through Poulters and Ravensbury Parks. New paths are being made along its course. There is provision for fishing as well as the normal scenic views.
